title: Schrager's new mock draft: Three QBs, two trades and Round 1 drama
content: Peter Schrager's debut piece for ESPN is a Round 1 mock draft based on what he's hearing from his sources.

title: Sources: USC recruit Arenas in coma after crash
content: Five-star prospect and USC commit Alijah Arenas has been placed in an induced coma after he was involved in a serious car crash in the Los Angeles area, sources told ESPN.

title: Ward huge favorite to be No. 1 pick of NFL draft
content: Miami QB Cam Ward is a big favorite to be the No. 1 pick in the NFL draft, and odds-on favorites also have emerged at picks two through five at sportsbooks around the nation.

title: Sources: Bucks, Horst reach multiyear extension
content: The Bucks have reached a multiyear extension with GM Jon Horst, sources told ESPN. Milwaukee has made the playoffs in all eight of Horst's seasons as GM.

title: Sources: '26 OT recruit Greene flips to Huskies
content: Four-star offensive tackle Kodi Greene, the No. 37 recruit in the 2026 ESPN 300, has flipped from Oregon to Washington, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: Brazil in talks again with Ancelotti's camp
content: Carlo Ancelotti is once again the front-runner for Brazil's vacant coaching job, sources told ESPN Brasil.

title: Mavs coach Kidd joins Everton ownership group
content: Dallas Mavericks head coach Jason Kidd has joined the ownership group of Everton, the Premier League club announced Thursday.

title: Larson miscue ends in crash at Indy 500 practice
content: Kyle Larson experienced his first IndyCar crash at Indianapolis Motor Speedway, hitting the Turn 1 wall during open testing on the 2.5-mile oval.

title: TGL considers expansion, adding women's league
content: Expansion of the tech-infused TGL will start with one additional team, while bringing in LPGA stars for a women's league also is under consideration.

title: How the 'uncs' became a driving force behind a historic turnaround in Detroit
content: The Pistons finished with one of the worst records in NBA history last season. Now, they enter Thursday's Game 3 tied 1-1 with the Knicks. What changed in Detroit?

title: The fishing ad that foreshadowed this incredible resurgence from Kawhi Leonard
content: Recent dominance has shown what kind of player Leonard still is -- and what his career could have been.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Can Senators, Blues turn the tide at home?
content: Both clubs are down 0-2 heading into Game 3. Plus, it's Game 2 of the Battle of Florida! Here's what to know.

title: Cheat sheet: Everything you need to know on top prospects, team needs, projections
content: Who are the best players in the class? Which teams need a QB? Here's our one-stop guide to the draft.

title: Welcome to the Cheap Seats at Clemson, home of college baseball's rowdiest fans
content: Fans in the raucous right-field grandstand at Doug Kingsmore Stadium have been ragging opposing teams for more than two decades.

title: For Rich Rodriguez and West Virginia is second time a charm?
content: Rodriguez led West Virginia to prominence when he was its head coach in the aughts. Can he work his magic again in 2025?

title: Ian Darke's Premier League flops of the season: Højlund, Foden, more
content: It's not been the easiest season for Man United or Rasmus Højlund, but who else has notably underperformed in the Premier League this season? Ian Darke makes his picks.

title: Bundesliga's race for Europe: Can Dortmund come back to reach UCL?
content: The Bundesliga table is tight near the top, with 11 teams possessing real and achievable European aspirations.

title: Vardy to leave Leicester: 'Our greatest-ever player'
content: Jamie Vardy will leave Leicester City at the end of the season, the Premier League club confirmed on Wednesday.

title: Szczesny on smoking: Don't follow my example
content: Barcelona goalkeeper Wojciech Szczesny has told ESPN he has lost his battle with smoking and urged others not to follow his lead.

title: Source: Bayern's Müller rejects Cincinnati offer
content: Bayern Munich midfielder/forward Thomas Müller has rejected a contract offer from FC Cincinnati, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: Ancelotti scolds Endrick for 'clowning' vs. Getafe
content: Real Madrid coach Carlo Ancelotti has scolded Endrick after his missed goal-scoring opportunity in Wednesday's 1-0 LaLiga win at Getafe.

title: Sources: Arsenal confident in Zubimendi deal
content: Arsenal are confident they will make Real Sociedad midfielder Martín Zubimendi their first major summer signing despite interest from Real Madrid, sources have told ESPN.

title: Arena: Poch doesn't understand culture of USMNT
content: Former USMNT coach Bruce Arena has criticized the appointment of current head coach Mauricio Pochettino, saying that a non-American lacks the necessary understanding of the country's culture.

title: Stanley Cup Playoffs Central: Bracket, schedule, scores, news
content: From the first round all the way through the Stanley Cup Final, ESPN has you covered this NHL postseason.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs odds: Stars a top 5 favorite after Game 3 win over Avalanche
content: Every playoff team's odds to win the Stanley Cup and favorites for the Conn Smythe Trophy for playoff MVP.

title: How does Cam Ward compare to other QBs who boosted draft stock in final collegiate season?
content: Cam Ward didn't finish his career where he started, but he went out strong. Here are other QBs who have done the same.

title: Bracketology: First look at 2026 has familiar teams on top line
content: South Carolina, UConn, UCLA and Texas are the No. 1 seeds in our first projection of the 2026 bracket.

title: Rankings, projections, strategy and cheat sheets
content: Rankings, projections, player profiles, draft strategies -- we've got everything you need to dominate your fantasy women's basketball draft from every angle.

title: Tucker finishes 2025 as fantasy's No. 1? Alonso hits .300? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: Chris Eubank Jr.-Conor Benn timeline: How their rivalry unfolded
content: Nick Parkinson looks at the rivalry between Eubank and Benn that started decades ago between their fathers.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal, Liverpool join Huijsen race
content: Arsenal, Chelsea, Liverpool and Newcastle United are all after Bournemouth's Spain international defender Dean Huijsen. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Thompson leads USWNT in ranking, but other internationals dominate
content: The NWSL MVP Tracker is back for 2025 to rank the best players, as Alyssa Thompson tries to catch Debinha and Temwa Chawinga.

title: EA Sports F1 25 preview: Aiming for the championships with Braking Point
content: Braking Point returns in EA F1 25, with new difficulty levels and a continuation of the game's story.

title: Trump Says Pressuring Russia To End Ukraine War, Claims Concessions
content: US President Donald Trump said Thursday he was applying pressure on Russia to end the Ukraine war, insisting that Moscow agreeing not to take over the entire country was a "big concession."

title: UN Chief Calls For "Maximum Restraint" After Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres calls on India and Pakistan to exercise "maximum restraint" to prevent further deterioration of the tense situation in the subcontinent after a terrorist attack in Kashmir.

title: Rahul Gandhi To Visit J&K Today, Days After Terror Attack In Pahalgam
content: Leader of the Opposition (LoP) in the Lok Sabha and Congress MP Rahul Gandhi will visit Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, on Friday, following the terrorist attack in Pahalgam.

title: Congress To Hold Candlelight Marches Over Pahalgam Terror Attack Today
content: Congress workers across all states and districts will take out candlelight marches on Friday in solidarity with the victims of the horrific Pahalgam terror attack and to reaffirm unity against terrorism, the party said.

title: Assam MLA Arrested For Pulwama, Pahalgam "Government Conspiracy" Comment
content: An MLA in Assam has been arrested over his comments on the terror attacks in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam and Pulwama.

title: Pahalgam Terror Attack Live Updates: Pakistan Says Diverting Indus Waters An 'Act Of War' After India Suspends Pact
content: Pahalgam terror attack updates: Twenty six tourists died in the attack in Jammu & Kashmir's Pahalgam on Tuesday. Both India and Pakistan have imposed severe measures against each other.

title: President Murmu To Attend State Funeral Of Pope Francis In Vatican City
content: President Droupadi Murmu will attend the state funeral of Pope Francis in Vatican City this week, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) said on Thursday.

title: Delhi Court Dismisses 26/11 Plotter Tahawwur Rana's Plea For Family Contact
content: The Patiala House Court of Delhi dismissed a plea filed by Tahawwur Rana on Thursday, seeking permission to speak with his family over the phone.

title: India Orders Pak Nationals To Leave, Revokes Visas; Islamabad Reacts
content: Ramping up its response after the five measures announced on Wednesday, India has revoked all visas issued to Pakistani nationals, including medical visas, and suspended visa services for Pakistanis.

title: US Judge Orders Trump Cannot Defund Migrant 'Sanctuary Cities'
content: A US judge ruled Thursday that Donald Trump cannot legally withhold federal funds from authorities offering limited protections to undocumented migrants, known as "sanctuary cities," as the president presses his aggressive mass deportation effort.

title: World Leaders Dial PM Modi As Tensions Between India And Pakistan Escalate
content: The Pahalgam terror attack, which killed 26 civilians, mostly tourists, has sparked widespread outrage and condemnation.

title: Policybazaar Co-Founder Alok Bansal Vows Support To Pahalgam Victims' Families
content: PB Fintech, the parent company of Policybazaar and Paisabazaar, is creating a foundation to support all impacted families of the Pahalgam terror attack in which 26 people were killed, co-founder Alok Bansal said.

title: Raised Questions, Expressed Support For Any Action Centre Takes: M Kharge On All Party Meet
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge said the opposition raised the issue of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's absence at Thursday's crucial all-party meeting on the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: 95 Criminal Groups Operating In Delhi: Government To Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court on Thursday mooted setting up special courts for speedy trial of cases of criminals as the Delhi government referred to 95 gangster groups operating in the national capital.

title: "Sustained Cross-Border Terror": India Writes To Pak On Halting Indus Treaty
content: India doubled down on the Indus water treaty suspension this evening, notifying Pakistan that it comes into effect immediately and explaining why -- sustained terror and other reasons.

title: "They Were Demons, Not Humans": Daughter Of Pahalgam Terror Attack Victim
content: Asavari Jagdale, whose father Santosh Jagdale and uncle Kaustubh Ganbote were killed in the Pahalgam terror attack, said the perpetrators were not humans but demons.

title: BluSmart Co-Founder Puneet Jaggi Detained From Delhi Hotel: Sources
content: EV cab service BluSmart co-founder Puneet Jaggi has been detained from a hotel in Delhi by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in a money laundering case linked to Gensol Group, another company that he co-founded, sources said today.

title: Trump Announces Interview With Reporter Who Uncovered Chat Leak Scandal
content: President Donald Trump announced Thursday he will sit for an interview with the reporter who uncovered a major security lapse after being inadvertently added to a group chat in which top US officials shared secret military strike plans.

title: Navy tests missile; IAF launches huge drill: India gets ready to avenge Pahalgam
content: INS Surat successfully tested a surface-to-air missile. The Indian Air Force executed 'Exercise Aakraman' with Rafale jets. These drills occurred after a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir. Tensions between India and Pakistan have increased. India suspended the Indus treaty. Pakistan responded by suspending the Simla Agreement. Prime Minister Narendra Modi vowed to punish terrorists and their supporters.

title: Pak hold on Simla Agreement signals shift away from peaceful resolution of disputes
content: Pakistan has put the Simla Agreement on hold, citing India's alleged support for terrorism and disregard for international law. This agreement, signed in 1972, aimed to establish peaceful relations and resolve disputes bilaterally. Experts suggest this move could invalidate the Line of Control and remove restraints on both sides, potentially escalating tensions and impacting India's foreign policy.

title: Minerals for US, militants for Kashmir: Pak's double game behind J&K attack
content: In Jammu and Kashmir, terrorists attacked near Pahalgam. Twenty-eight people died in the assault. The Resistance Front claimed responsibility for the attack. The attack happened during US Vice President JD Vance’s India visit. Attackers demanded victims recite Islamic verses. Some survived by reciting the kalma. Pakistan's military posture and mineral ambitions are under scrutiny.

title: SC: Why no pension for lady who raised stepson?
content: The Supreme Court questioned the Indian Air Force's denial of family pension to a stepmother who raised her stepson from childhood, enabling him to join the forces. Justices Kant and Singh challenged the IAF's regulations, deeming them inflexible in modern family structures, including surrogacy and adoption.

title: Elon Musk replies to JD Vance's family photos from Taj Mahal: One of the ...
content: US Vice President JD Vance, accompanied by his family, recently visited the Taj Mahal during a four-day trip to India. Vance shared photos on X, with Elon Musk commenting on the monument's beauty. The family's visit included a warm welcome from Uttar Pradesh's Chief Minister and stringent security measures along their route.

title: Pahalgam killings against tenets of Islam, says Darul
content: Prominent Muslim institutions and groups in Uttar Pradesh have vehemently condemned the Pahalgam terror attack, with Darul Uloom Deoband denouncing the act as inhuman and against Islamic teachings. Leaders called for unity and strict action against the perpetrators. Aligarh Muslim University students held a vigil, and residents in Muzaffarnagar protested against terrorism, showcasing a rare display of communal unity.

title: DKS' serial visits to temples spark unease in Congress
content: Karnataka's Deputy CM DK Shivakumar has been actively engaging in spiritual activities, visiting temples and religious leaders, sparking both praise and criticism. While BJP leaders have welcomed his displays of faith, some within his own Congress party worry about the message it sends to their minority support base.

title: SC to hear petition challenging clubbing of Balaji 'scam' cases
content: The Supreme Court has agreed to review a plea challenging the consolidation of four chargesheets related to corruption in appointments for various positions, including assistant engineers and bus drivers, within the Tamil Nadu transport sector. These cases are linked to a cash-for-jobs scam involving minister V Senthil Balaji.

title: Microsoft HR head gives employees 5 days 'deadline' to ... or leave the company
content: Microsoft is implementing a new performance strategy, offering underperforming employees a severance package of 16 weeks' pay to voluntarily leave instead of entering a Performance Improvement Plan (PIP). Employees have five days to decide, and those choosing the PIP forfeit the payout.

title: Pakistan closes airspace for Indian carriers
content: Flights between North India and the West face disruptions as Pakistan closes its airspace, effective Thursday. Indian carriers will take longer routes, potentially adding up to two hours to North America flights and an hour to Europe flights. IndiGo has already cancelled some flights, while Air India and SpiceJet advise passengers to expect extended routes and check flight status.

title: SC approves finalisation of UGC Regulations 2025
content: The Supreme Court has approved the finalization and notification of the UGC's 2025 Regulations aimed at preventing caste-based discrimination in higher education. While acknowledging concerns raised by student representatives, the court emphasized the regulations' potential benefit to a large number of students. Recommendations from the National Task Force on student suicides will be considered separately.

title: Hazlewood delivers RCB’s first Chinnaswamy win in IPL 2025
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru secured a crucial victory against Rajasthan Royals, fueled by Virat Kohli's composed seventy and Josh Hazlewood's game-changing final overs. Kohli's innings anchored Bengaluru's innings, while Hazlewood's exceptional death bowling restricted Rajasthan's chase, ultimately sealing an eleven-run win for the home side. This victory propelled Bengaluru to third place, while Rajasthan's playoff aspirations suffered a setback.

title: 'This was a TERRORIST ATTACK plain and simple': US Foreign Affairs Committee to NYT
content: Following the terror attack on tourists in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam, the US government, including President Trump, strongly condemned the violence and expressed condolences to PM Modi. The US House Foreign Affairs Committee corrected the New York Times' use of 'militants,' emphasizing it was a 'terrorist attack.

title: J&K all-party meet calls Pahalgam massacre 'assault on Kashmiriyat, idea of India'
content: Following the tragic Pahalgam massacre, an all-party meeting led by Chief Minister Omar Abdullah strongly condemned the terror attack, emphasizing its assault on Kashmiriyat and Indian values. The resolution supported government measures to bring the perpetrators to justice, honored the pony guide's sacrifice, and praised the Kashmiri people's support for tourists.

title: 2 Navy officers held for fleecing Agniveer aspirants
content: Odisha police have apprehended two active Indian Navy personnel and one former employee in Khurda for allegedly extorting money from Agniveer aspirants. The accused, including Vinay Kumar Ray, Satyam Chahar, and Bhoosan, reportedly demanded between Rs 30,000 and Rs 1.2 lakh from candidates, promising assistance in clearing recruitment stages at INS Chilka.

title: Massive landslides hit north Sikkim; permits for travel suspended amid heavy rain
content: Landslides triggered by incessant rainfall have severely disrupted travel in North Sikkim, specifically along the Lachen–Chungthang and Lachung–Chungthang roads. Authorities have deemed nighttime travel unsafe and suspended the issuance of permits for North Sikkim. All previously issued permits have been cancelled. Relief and repair efforts are underway, but hampered by the continuous downpour.

title: 'I'll never be able to forget': First respondent at Pahalgam meadow after massacre
content: Following a terror attack in Baisaran meadow, Pahalgam, Abdul Waheed Wani, head of the ponywalla association, was among the first responders. He recounted a scene of chaos and grief, with numerous casualties and desperate pleas for help. Despite the challenging circumstances, Wani and other ponywallas played a crucial role in evacuating the injured, while security forces secured the area.

title: 'I am a Hindu - a proud one': Ex-Pakistan cricketer on Pahalgam terror attack
content: Former Pakistani cricketer Danish Kaneria criticized Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif for the Pahalgam terror attack, questioning his silence and accusing Pakistan of harboring terrorists. Kaneria defended his loyalty to Pakistan despite being Hindu, highlighting the discrimination faced by Hindus there. The Pahalgam attack — the deadliest since the 2019 Pulwama tragedy — drew widespread condemnation globally. Leaders from around the world, along with prominent voices from the cricketing fraternity and other industries, expressed their condolences to the victims and their families.

title: Security lapses, stricter action: Key points from all-party meet
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, an all-party meeting was convened where opposition leaders pledged their support to the government's counter-terrorism efforts. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh briefed attendees on the attack and subsequent government decisions, while security lapses were discussed. Opposition leaders uniformly condemned the attack, emphasising the need for peace in Kashmir and urging the government to take decisive action against terrorism.

title: Gavaskar’s moments with IPL robo-dog Champak go viral - Watch
content: Cricket legend Sunil Gavaskar was seen enjoying a playful moment with Champak, the IPL's new robot dog, at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium before a match between Royal Challengers Bengaluru and Rajasthan Royals. Champak, named through an online poll referencing a popular TV character, impressed Gavaskar with its ability to jump and run.

title: PM Modi's warning rattles Pak as suspense builds over India's next move
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 people, India has taken decisive steps signaling a strong response against Pakistan. Prime Minister Modi vowed to punish the terrorists and their backers, leading to the suspension of visa services for Pakistani nationals and the revocation of existing visas among several other measures.

title: Nepal medic killed in Pahalgam didn’t get time to say he was a foreigner
content: Sudeep Neupane, 27, was cremated at Triveni Ghat around noon, with hundreds, including local govt officials, gathered for the last rites. Sudeep, his family said, was shot immediately after he identified himself as a Hindu and had no time to explain that he was not from India.

title: On-field umpire overrules third umpire in bizarre IPL blunder
content: During an IPL 2025 match between Royal Challengers Bengaluru and Rajasthan Royals, an umpire's hasty LBW decision created a stir. Initially signaling OUT on Krunal Pandya's appeal against Dhruv Jurel, the umpire quickly reversed his call to NOT OUT after Jurel's review showed a clear inside edge. Earlier, Virat Kohli and Devdutt Padikkal's half-centuries propelled RCB to 205/5 in Bengaluru.

title: This NCR locality saw 98% property price surge in just 5 years
content: NCR's real estate market is experiencing a significant resurgence, marked by an 81% surge in residential property prices between 2020 and 2025. Greater Noida leads with a 98% price appreciation, followed by Noida and Gurugram. Declining unsold inventory and a shift towards premium housing indicate strong buyer confidence and investment potential, fueled by infrastructure developments and emerging corridors.

title: J&K: Kathua journo assaulted while covering BJP protest over terror attack
content: In Kathua, Jammu & Kashmir, journalist Rakesh Sharma was assaulted and hospitalized while covering a BJP protest against the Pahalgam terror attack. The assault occurred after Sharma questioned state security, leading to accusations of “separatist language” by party activist Himanshu Sharma. Other activists, including Ravinder Singh, Ashwani Sharma, and Manjit Singh, joined in the assault.

title: No Army present, say locals; CRPF camp about 5 km from Pahalgam meadow
content: Pahalgam sees heavy Army deployment during the Amarnath Yatra, but locals report a reduced presence otherwise. Restrictions are placed on tourist access during the yatra, including the closure of Baisaran meadow. Following Tuesday's terror attack, a large number of troops were present in the meadow, with aerial reconnaissance and combing operations underway.

title: ED raids Gensol office, co-founder Puneet Singh Jaggi detained
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) raided Gensol Engineering Ltd offices and detained co-promoter Puneet Singh Jaggi amid financial misconduct allegations. This action, triggered by a SEBI report, accuses the Jaggi brothers of diverting funds obtained from Power Finance Corporation and IREDA Ltd into assets held by promoters and shell companies.

title: Record! Kohli leaves Azam behind in another historic milestone
content: Virat Kohli achieved a new milestone in T20 cricket. He now holds the record for the most half-centuries while batting first. This happened during the IPL match between Royal Challengers Bengaluru and Rajasthan Royals. Kohli scored 70 runs. RCB reached a total of 205/5. Sandeep Sharma and Jofra Archer took wickets for RR.

title: Pakistan's Nadeem absent as players unveiled for Neeraj Chopra Classic
content: Bengaluru is set to host the Neeraj Chopra Classic on May 24. This Gold-Label javelin meet will feature top international athletes. Anderson Peters, Thomas Rohler, and Julius Yego are among the stars. Arshad Nadeem will miss the event due to the Asian Athletics Championships. The competition aims to inspire Indian athletes.

title: Spooked by threat video, Kashmir students flee Doon
content: Fearing for their safety after a threatening video by Hindu Raksha Dal leader Lalit Sharma went viral, six Kashmiri students fled their Dehradun hostel in the early hours of Thursday. Sharma's video warned Kashmiri Muslims to leave Uttarakhand by 10 am or face consequences, prompting the students to rush to the airport.

title: No mercy! Rajasthan Royals' brutal Powerplay tactic is shocking everyone
content: Rajasthan Royals are dominating the IPL 2025 Powerplay with a league-leading 37 sixes, showcasing their aggressive batting strategy. Kolkata Knight Riders, Mumbai Indians, and Punjab Kings follow behind. Chennai Super Kings are surprisingly at the bottom with only five Powerplay sixes. Earlier, Royal Challengers Bengaluru posted a competitive 205 for five, powered by fluent half-centuries from Virat Kohli (70 off 42) and Devdutt Padikkal (50 off 27).

title: IAF conducts huge 'Aakraman' exercise amid rising India-Pak tensions
content: The Indian Air Force is conducting Exercise Aakraman, a large-scale operational drill in the central sector, featuring Rafale jets and other frontline aircraft. The exercise focuses on advanced mission profiles, including ground attack and electronic warfare, with assets deployed from multiple airbases. This drill comes amid heightened tensions with Pakistan and showcases the IAF's enhanced strategic capabilities with modern weaponry.

title: 'For the last 78 years ... ': Gavaskar's emotional outburst on Live TV
content: Sunil Gavaskar passionately condemned the Pahalgam terror attack during a live IPL broadcast, questioning the purpose of the violence and urging for peace. BCCI Secretary Devajit Saikia also issued a strong statement, expressing condolences and solidarity with the victims' families. The BCCI further conveyed its condolences via social media, standing in support of those affected by the tragic event.

title: Class act! Yashasvi Jaiswal ahead of Virat Kohli in rare record
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal etched his name in IPL history during the 2025 match against Royal Challengers Bengaluru, smashing a six off the very first ball. This feat marked his third time achieving this, making him the record holder for most sixes on the first ball of an innings. Earlier, Royal Challengers Bengaluru posted a competitive 205 for five, powered by fluent half-centuries from Virat Kohli (70 off 42) and Devdutt Padikkal (50 off 27).

title: 'A king is one who ...': Viv Richards makes big Babar Azam comment
content: Sir Vivian Richards has voiced his support for Babar Azam amidst his current struggles, assuring fans of his imminent return to form. Despite recent poor performances and being dropped from the T20I squad, Richards remains confident in Babar's resilience. Salman Iqbal predicts Babar will surpass even Virat Kohli upon his resurgence, comparing him to legends like Garry Sobers.

title: 'Lied to his wife that he was alive': Operator who rushed navy officer to ambulance
content: In Pahalgam, Kashmir, a terror attack killed Navy Lieutenant Vinay Narwal. He was honeymooning with his wife, Himanshi, when gunmen attacked. Irshad Ahmad, a local, helped them after the shooting. Narwal, recently married, died at the scene. His family in Karnal mourns the loss. The Navy and community remember him as a dedicated officer. Authorities are investigating the attack.

title: 'I wish I'd died': England cricket legend's devastating revelation
content: Andrew Flintoff, the former England cricket captain, has opened up about the profound impact of his near-fatal car crash during Top Gear filming in 2022. He candidly admits that he felt it would have been "much easier" if he had died, revealing the depth of his despair following the incident. Flintoff retired from cricket in 2010 at the age of 31, having represented England in 79 Test matches between 1998 and 2009.

title: 'Vladimir, STOP!': In rare criticism, Donald Trump urges Putin to end war
content: Donald Trump criticized Vladimir Putin following a massive Russian strike on Ukraine that resulted in casualties and significant damage. Trump urged Putin to stop the attacks, citing heavy troop losses and advocating for a peace deal. The strikes targeted Ukraine's aviation, aerospace, and defense industries, prompting President Zelenskyy to condemn Russia's actions and appeal for international awareness and accountability.

title: 'They kept on laughing till my husband died': Wife laments inadequate security
content: Shital Kalathiya, wife of slain Surat banker Shailesh Kalathiya, has demanded justice following the Pahalgam terror attack. At her husband's funeral, attended by ministers and a large crowd, she criticized the security arrangements in Jammu and Kashmir. She alleged security forces failed to protect citizens and questioned why VIPs receive preferential treatment while her husband lacked essential security.

title: Assam Police arrests AIUDF MLA Aminul Islam over remarks on Pahalgam attack
content: Assam Police arrested AIUDF MLA Aminul Islam for allegedly making derogatory remarks about the Pahalgam terror attack during a public gathering. His statement, deemed misleading and instigating, went viral, prompting charges under the Bharatiya Nyay Samhita. Chief Minister Sarma vowed strong action against anyone defending the attack.

title: Royals skipper Parag gives massive update on Sanju Samson
content: Rajasthan Royals fans are hopeful as Riyan Parag shares that Sanju Samson is nearing his return from a finger injury. Samson's absence has impacted the team's performance, with the Royals currently struggling in the standings. Parag has stepped up as captain, making strategic changes like bringing in Fazalhaq Farooqi, while eagerly awaiting Samson's comeback to revitalize the team's season.

title: All Pakistan nationals ordered to leave India within 72 hrs
content: India has suspended all visas for Pakistani citizens. They must leave the country by April 27. Medical visas are valid until April 29. This decision follows the Pahalgam terror attack. PM Narendra Modi vowed to punish those responsible. Indians are advised against traveling to Pakistan. Those in Pakistan should return home soon.

title: 'This is bizarre': Princess Isabella breaks royal protocol for 18th bday photo
content: ​Princess Isabella of Denmark is the second child and the elder daughter of King Frederik X and Queen Mary. She is the fourth grandchild and oldest granddaughter of Queen Margrethe II and Prince Henrik. She was the first girl born into the Danish royal family since the birth of her great aunt, Queen Anne-Marie of Greece, in 1946.

title: ‘Very close’: India may be first to sign trade pact, says US treasury secy
content: India may soon be the first nation to strike a bilateral trade deal with the US under President Trump's reciprocal tariff policy, according to US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent. Negotiations are reportedly near a breakthrough, facilitated by India's relatively low tariffs and minimal trade barriers.

title: NBA playoff odds: Celtics win again, on collision course with West favorite Thunder
content: the top-seeded Oklahoma City Thunder entered the playoffs as favorites to win the NBA championship . the Los Angeles Lakers , Golden State Warriors , LA Clippers , Denver Nuggets and Minnesota Timberwolves all have better odds . they have traded series-favorite status with their Game 1 and Game 2 wins .

title: Why Nico Iamaleava soured on Tennessee and ended up at UCLA
content: Iamaleava was set to make around $2.4 million at Tennessee this year, sources say . sources close to the quarterback deny they were seeking $4 million . he needed to take a "mental break" after the Vols' 42-17 loss to the college football world .

title: Power Rankings: There's a new No. 1 ... again
content: just 2.5 games separate four teams -- three of which have winning percentages above .600 -- in the NL West . in the american league, while the Yankees are playing as well as projected, a number of teams are hovering around .500, the Orioles are scuffling and the Twins have the second-worst record in the league .

title: Expert's picks, best bets: Can Machado Garry elude Prates' hard strikes?
content: welterweight contenders Ian Machado Garry and Carlos Prates will clash to determine who moves closer to a title shot at UFC Fight Night on sunday . the fight follows the first loss of his career against Shavkat Rakhmonov in December .

title: Toronto's Pearson Airport shut down after shooting, 1 dead
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . toi World Desk is a dedicated team of journalists and writers who strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world .

title: BSF jawan detained by Pak Rangers after he accidentally crosses border
content: the TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Rattled by India, Pak suspends Simla peace treaty: What is it?
content: the TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: 2008 Mumbai attack: Delhi court junks Tahawwur Rana plea to talk to kin
content: The NIA opposed the application, arguing he could share crucial information if allowed to speak with his family members

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Gloom gives way to rage as kin of victims raise poor security
content: There were no security personnel at the time of attack, and nearest security camps are a few kilometres away; officials say government’s policy is to keep Army away from tourist destinations; no communication signal could be traced, says Home Minister Amit Shah

title: Karnataka government brings back 175 tourists stranded in Kashmir
content: Minister Lad confirms an additional 20 to 22 tourists remain in Kashmir and are expected to return shortly via commercial flights

title: Tamil Nadu is currently home to over 10,800 start-ups, says T.M. Anbarasan
content: Delivering the valedictory address at The Hindu Tamil Nadu Startup Summit-25, he says the construction of a regional innovation centre has been planned in Thoothukudi in this fiscal, and regional innovation centres have been set up in Erode, Tirunelveli, Hosur, Salem, Cuddalore, Thanjavur, and Coimbatore

title: Startup Summit-25 | Healthcare industry is in need of technology intervention at all levels: experts
content: Panelists recall from their experience the benefit that have accrued to patients and medical professionals

title: To have and to hold
content: Single people over 60 in Maharashtra are choosing companionship — both marriage and live-in partnerships — as they lose loved ones and the reality of years living alone hits. Purnima Sah explores the emotional and legal complexities of such relationships and how senior couples face them together

title: Tears, heartbreak as bodies of Bengal tourists reach home
content: Leaders from both Trinamool Congress and BJP have demanded compensation to the family of the deceased tourists

title: Pahalgam terror attack: India to explore ‘never considered’ options on Indus Waters Treaty
content: These may include withdrawing from talks on evolving a new ‘Dispute Resolution Mechanism,’ change the design of its hydropower electric projects to allow it to store greater quantities of water

title: LIC to expedite claim settlements of Pahalgam terror victims
content: For assistance, the claimants may contact the nearest LIC branch, division, or customer zones. They may also call LIC call centre at 022 68276827, the company said

title: More than a smile: why orthodontic care for students is imperative
content: Studies suggest that 20%-30% of schoolchildren may require orthodontic attention. But treatment is often delayed because of cost, lack of awareness, or stigma. The Virudhunagar model shows the way forward to deal with the problem at the district level

title: Uttarakhand to make 1 lakh people learn Sanskrit to make it ‘common’ spoken language
content: CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said that the project for Sanskrit learning for common people will be implemented in a phased manner and government will come up with schemes to ensure jobs for youth learning Sanskrit.

title: Brace for longer flights to Gulf, Europe and the U.S. as Pakistan shuts airspace
content: Indian airlines are bracing for significantly longer flight times – potentially adding up to 90 minutes for U.S. routes – and probable fare increases after the move currently stipulated by a Notice to Airmen to last until May 23

title: Elderly man trampled to death by elephant in Wayanad
content: The victim was identified as Arumukhan, a Tamil Nadu native who was living in Poolakkolli tribal hamlet

title: Andhra Pradesh Govt. decides to initiate disciplinary action against IPS officer P.V. Sunil Kumar
content: Sunil Kumar is facing charges related to misbehaviour and misconduct regarding his foreign trips, as per a G.O. issued by Chief Secretary

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Tourists taken to meadow without police permission, government informs all-party meeting
content: Home Minister Amit Shah, according to sources, said that the response from security officials was delayed because of the terrain

title: State mourning to conclude on Saturday with Pope Francis’ funeral
content: The National Flag will be flown at half-mast in all buildings, and there will be no official entertainment scheduled for the day

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Militaries of India, Pakistan on high alert
content: Amid escalating tensions, the Indian Navy’s latest guided missile destroyer INS Surat fired a medium-range surface-to-air missile against a ‘sea skimming’ target in the western Indian Ocean

title:
A publication that spotlights antiquity
of fiscal administration in Tamil land
content:
Tamil Nadu’s revenue expenditure exceeded the ₹100-
crore mark during 1961-62. Seven years later, revenue receipts touched the ₹200-crore mark. In 1980-81, both revenue receipts and revenue expenditure crossed the ₹1,000-crore mark for the first time. These are among the interesting details captured in the book by the Finance Department

title: Pahalgam attack: Naidu urges people to stand by Modi
content: It is not just an assault on national security but also as a deliberate attempt to disrupt India’s rising economic trajectory, says CM

title: Tejashwi Yadav termed Pahalgam attack an intelligence failure
content: Tejashwi Yadav alleged that out of political vendetta, the Centre deploys most of the central agencies behind the opposition leaders, but fails to use them against the terrorists.

title: Governor gives nod to Greater Bengaluru Governance Bill
content: The legislation will allow for establishment of the Greater Bengaluru Authority (GBA) for coordinating and supervising the development of the greater Bengaluru area

title: Parsi woman who changed the dynamics of social work when funds were at a premium
content:
Mary Clubwala Jadhav was born in Udhagamandalam on June 10, 1908. At the age 27, she lost her husband and joined the Guild of Service. Realising the need for professionals to continue social work, she visited various countries. The result was the Madras School of Social Work that she founded on the lines of the 
Tata  Institute of Social Sciences

title: Assam MLA held after he hints at BJP ‘conspiracy’ behind Pahalgam attack
content: Aminul Islam said at a rally that he suspects a connection between the Pulwama attack and the Pahalgam incident

title: Protest against move to permit new house boats in Alappuzha
content: Move poses serious threat to the fragile ecosystem of Vembanad Lake and can jeopardise the strained houseboat tourism sector in Alappuzha, say protesters

title: Baruipur police dismiss Suvendu Adhikari’s claim of ‘suspicious’ device installation by alleged Kashmiris
content: As verification revealed the individuals in question are from Madhya Pradesh, police urged against the spreading of unverified information online

title: 15-year-old boys among the attackers, says Pahalgam victim’s son
content: After his father Sushil Nathaniel’s last rites in Indore, son Austen says the gunmen even pulled down pants of victims to confirm their religious identity before shooting them

title: Issue public notice for removal of unauthorised emblems, symbols, stickers, names and logos from public and private vehicles within four weeks: Karnataka High Court
content: ‘There an unfortunate tendency amongst ex-MPs, ex-MLAs of misusing emblems and symbols on their letterheads and vehicles’

title: It was a deadly gamble, but I had no choice, Jain Kurian recounts his escape from Russia
content: The youth from Wadakkancherry was forcibly enlisted into the Russian Army and got injured in the Russia-Ukraine war zone

title: New batch of AI online training by KITE from May 10
content: Admission will be given to the first 2,500 people who register. Applications can be submitted till May 3

title: Late start no barrier to her special UPSC victory
content: A 40-year-old aurally challenged woman cracks the Civil Services Examination in her seventh attempt, securing the 1,000th rank

title: Jammalamadugu to contribute amount as financial assistance to Indian Army: Adinarayana Reddy
content: The former Minister calls the recent Pahalgam attack as an act of cowardice aimed at disturbing peace in the State of Jammu and Kashmir

title: Munnar receives more tourist enquiries in the wake of Kashmir terrorist attack
content: Stakeholders think tourists, especially those from north India, will shift their travel plans to Munnar instead of Kashmir as climate and topography of the destinations are almost the same

title: Police bust ganja peddling gang in Nellore
content: Santhapeta police arrest a gang of five persons for selling ganja and seize 5 kg ganja worth ₹2.5 lakh from them

title: A forgotten hero re-emerges as Congress, BJP lay claim to his legacy
content: Chettur Sanakaran Nair, a trailblazing figure who made history as the sole Malayali to hold the office of the Indian National Congress president in 1897, has faded from memory largely due to the party’s own oversight and flawed narrative

title: NDA alliance rule in A.P. is disastrous, says former MP
content: Incumbent government marked by rampant corruption, nepotism and indifference to the plight of the poor, alleges senior CPI(M) leader P. Madhu

title: Anjuman-e-Islam stages protests against terror attack in Pahalgam
content: Condemning the attack, members of the Muslim organisation submit memoranda seeking stringent action against terrorists

title: Opposition protest disrupts Kannur Corporation Council meet
content: The meeting, which began at 11 a.m., was wrapped up within five minutes after Mayor Muslih Madathil rushed through the agenda amid the chaos

title: No confidence motion in KSCARD Bank passed, but declaration of results put on hold
content: Director board, which has a UDF majority, has maintained that neither  Cooperative Societies Act nor bylaw of KSCARD Bank provides for no confidence motion

title: Srisailam temple officials to preserve ancient sites and scriptures
content: The ancient inscriptions and structures at Srisailam temple stand as a testimony that the famous temple had once flourished as a centre for spiritual, cultural, education and medicine, says Srisailam temple EO

title: Bindu inaugurates Kerala Institute of Science, Technology and Innovation at M.G. University
content: Centres of Excellence envisioned to improve quality of life and strengthen economic foundations of society based on knowledge, says Minister

title: Ensure drinking water supply during summer in Krishna district, Minister tells officials
content: Vasamsetti Subhash expresses happiness at the students from the district scoring well in both Class X and Inter examinations

title: General Hospital in Thiruvananthapuram set to have a major makeover
content: Govt. accords sanction to the ₹137.35-crore project that will be funded by the KIIFB. The new buildings will have specialty and superspecialty services, multi-disciplinary ICU, advanced trauma care, dialysis, and chemotherapy facilities

title: Mundra drugs haul case accused says his children were bullied in school after NIA claims in Supreme Court
content: The National Investigation Agency has claimed that proceeds of crime were funnelled to the Lashkar-e-Taiba to finance terror attacks like in Pahalgam

title: Minister promises to look into enhancing recurring expenses of KMCRI in Hubballi
content: Sharanprakash Patil has said that he will take up the demand with the Finance Department after verifying data for the last three years

title: As Canada Votes In 2025 Elections, A Look Back At The Longest-Serving Prime Minister
content: William Lyon Mackenzie King served as Canada's prime minister for 21 years and 154 days from 1921 to 1948 . he was appointed to the newly established federal Department of Labour in 1900, where he played a key role in arbitrating labour disputes . his efforts led to the creation of the 1907 Industrial Disputes Investigation Act .

title: When Can Canadians Expect To Know The 2025 Election Results?
content: the results will determine the next government and prime minister . polls will open across the country at 9 am local time and close at 9:30 pm (6:30 pm IST and 7:00 am IST the next day, respectively) the final results will be reported as polling stations close in the Pacific time zone .
